alert.note: Alert for Clay; Quitman (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 5:13PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Clay, western Randolph and southeastern Quitman Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 513 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Cuthbert. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cuthbert, Springvale Station, Pachitla, Peterson Hill, Coles, White House, Crossroads, Randolph Co A/p, Garnersville, Goffs Mill, Hatcher, Morris, Springvale, Cotton Hill, Shivers Mill and Coleman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
